segment.source: Audit process tracking (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit process tracking (Windows 10)

segment.source: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.

segment.source: Audit process tracking
segment.target: Audit process tracking

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.

segment.source: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.
segment.target: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.

segment.source: Success audits generate an audit entry when the process being tracked succeeds.
segment.target: Success audits generate an audit entry when the process being tracked succeeds.

segment.source: Failure audits generate an audit entry when the process being tracked fails.
segment.target: Failure audits generate an audit entry when the process being tracked fails.

segment.source: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.
segment.target: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.

segment.source: Default: No auditing.
segment.target: Default: No auditing.

segment.source: Configure this this security setting
segment.target: Configure this this security setting

segment.source: You can configure this security setting under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.
segment.target: You can configure this security setting under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.

segment.source: Process tracking events
segment.target: Process tracking events

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: A new process was created.
segment.target: A new process was created.

segment.source: A process exited.
segment.target: A process exited.

segment.source: A handle to an object was duplicated.
segment.target: A handle to an object was duplicated.

segment.source: Indirect access to an object was obtained.
segment.target: Indirect access to an object was obtained.

segment.source: A data protection master key was backed up.
segment.target: A data protection master key was backed up.

segment.source: Note: The master key is used by the CryptProtectData and CryptUnprotectData routines, and Encrypting File System (EFS).
segment.target: Note: The master key is used by the CryptProtectData and CryptUnprotectData routines, and Encrypting File System (EFS).

segment.source: The master key is backed up each time a new one is created.
segment.target: The master key is backed up each time a new one is created.

segment.source: (The default setting is 90 days.) The key is usually backed up to a domain controller.
segment.target: (The default setting is 90 days.) The key is usually backed up to a domain controller.

segment.source: A data protection master key was recovered from a recovery server.
segment.target: A data protection master key was recovered from a recovery server.

segment.source: Auditable data was protected.
segment.target: Auditable data was protected.

segment.source: Auditable data was unprotected.
segment.target: Auditable data was unprotected.

segment.source: A process was assigned a primary token.
segment.target: A process was assigned a primary token.

segment.source: A user attempted to install a service.
segment.target: A user attempted to install a service.

segment.source: A scheduler job was created.
segment.target: A scheduler job was created.

segment.target: Related topics
